intro: Oldenlandia somala var. scabridula, commonly known as the scabrous Oldenlandia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine, rough texture, giving it a scabrous appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
